intro: Solenocarpus, commonly known as poison hemlock, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Solenocarpus contains toxic compounds, particularly coniine, which can be harmful to humans and animals if ingested. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in woodland areas.
